EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0)) [warning: no ingredients to smelt]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0)) [status: WAITING_FOR_SPACE_IN_DESTINATION; warning: output blocked by item on the ground (no sink entity to accept output); fuel inventory: {'coal': 7}]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5)) [status: NO_FUEL; warning: out of fuel]
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5)) [drop position; sink placement failed due to obstructions or insufficient space]
– Iron Chest (position: (–13.5, –49.5)) [status: NORMAL]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5)) [status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS; fuel inventory: {'coal': 1}]
– Iron Chest (position: (–13.5, –47.5)) [status: NORMAL]

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0)) [warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5)) [status: NO_POWER]
– Offshore Pump (position: (–7.5, 25.5)) [status: WORKING; fluid_box contains water (~100 units)]
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) [status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections]
– Steam Engine (position: (5.5, 5.5)) [status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: not connected to power network, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5)) [status: NO_POWER; warnings: not receiving electricity, cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …) connected by ElectricityGroup [id=37937, voltage=0]

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of multiple PipeGroups:
• PipeGroups distributed at positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5) and (–1.5, 21.5) [status: mostly EMPTY]
• Notably, the PipeGroup at (–9.5, 9.5) (fluid_system=123312) is WORKING with water

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and link mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections for the Iron Ore Mining Setup (e.g., Transport Belts at (–15.5, –49.5) and (–15.5, –47.5))
– Electricity Network integrated with Small Electric Poles (ElectricityGroup now with id=37937, voltage=0)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Connectivity and Intermediate Placement Errors
  – Ensure fluid connection points between the Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5) and the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) are unobstructed and properly aligned.
  – Validate that any intermediate connection candidate positions (e.g., (–2.75, 21.5)) are buildable and free of obstructions.
• Output Sink Integration and Blockage Resolution for Burner Mining Drill
  – Establish a proper sink entity at the drop position (–15.5, –49.5) by verifying sufficient buildable space and absence of obstructions.
  – Confirm usage of compatible prototypes when placing sink entities (e.g., verify the intended chest type is available).
  – If transport belt placement fails, consider alternative sink setups to relieve output blockage.
• Existing Power and Fluid Supply Issues
  – For issues with the Assembling Machine and fluid supply to the Boiler/Steam Engine, ensure proper resource provisioning and secure connections to functional power and fluid networks.
  – Reassess electrical pole placement and network links to activate the Electricity Network.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if the entity is not found.
• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.
• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.
• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.
• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
